attributes.action: Give carers allowance to people with an overlapping benefit during COVID-19
attributes.additional_details:
Those who are looking after vulnerable people at home full time due to government restrictions should be entitled to extra assistance during this time period. 

This can be a 24/7 job, and it is wrong and de-humanising to not offer a package to these people.  The vulnerable people they are looking after were often typically in day programmes or residential care facilities prior to COVID-19. They now can be in a situation where relatives are looking after them with no extra support.
attributes.background:
People caring for disabled or vulnerable relatives full time due to COVID-19 are not entitled to carers allowance if they have an overlapping benefit (such as a state pension). 

Make it so that they are throughout a period with any restrictions in place and get back pay too.
